Key Match Events: South Africa posted 399 on the board and waltzed to victory by 229 runs
England crumbled under the weight of a gargantuan target, losing 7 wickets for 67 runs
Heinrich Klaasen's 109 off 67 helped South Africa post a massive total
Gus Atkinson and Mark Wood put up a 70-run stand, but it was too little, too late for England
Pre-Game Insights: England captain Jos Buttler said that conditions were extremely tough, and they needed to get off to a good start with the bat
South Africa captain Aiden Markram said that they knew England liked chasing, and they were happy to bat first
Post-Match Reflections: Heinrich Klaasen said that it was one of his best innings, and he was pleased to have contributed to the team's win
Jos Buttler said that England were short of their mark, and they were well beaten
Aiden Markram said that the team's confidence is back, and they are looking forward to their next match
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in extremely hot conditions, with the temperature soaring to 40 degrees Celsius
South Africa's win has put them in a strong position in the tournament, while England will have to regroup and come back stronger
The match was a one-sided affair, with South Africa dominating from start to finish
